results.title: Children of Peru
results.creator_credit: Michael Andrews and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Documents new agricultural methods and technological discoveries in Peru and the beneficial effects these might have on the health and nutrition of the children of Peru if implemented. Narrated by paul Vaughan. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.
results.description:

results.title: Kangaroos. Part 1. Biography
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, Ian Walker, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
Part one begins with the evolution of the kangaroo, tracing its development into over 50 species, from tree-dwellers to the better-known “big red”. The feeding, and mating habits of various species are examined, also birth and development in the pouch are studied. Narrated by Lionel Long.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Shaw, Ian Walker, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.description:

results.title: Kangaroos. Part 2. Varieties
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, Ian Walker, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
Shows some of the variously adapted species of kangaroos in their natural environments: rat Kangaroos, quokkas, tree kangaroos, forest wallabies, rock wallabies and others.

results.title: Cancer: the smoker's gamble
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
What does all the research which has been carried out in Britain and America in recent years add up to? This enquiry undertakes a detailed study of the latest scientific evidence and assesses meaning. Three establishments pursuing different lines of controversial research, are visited.
results.description:

results.title: The Broken bridge
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
A report on the work of the American therapist Irene Kassorla in treating autistic children by operant conditioning. Film of therapy sessions over six months, during which remarkable progress is achieved and new hope is given to troubled parents.

results.title: Breaking in children (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Behaviour therapy although popular in the US as a method of treating difficult children is usually regarded by British authorities as fit only for animal training. This program looks at a therapist in Belfast working with two uncontrollable children and their mothers in an obey-reward, non compliance-punishment regime.
results.description:

results.title: Kangaroos. Part 1. Biography [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
Part one begins with the evolution of the kangaroo, tracing its development into over 50 species, from tree-dwellers to the better-known “big red”. The feeding, and mating habits of various species are examined, also birth and development in the pouch are studied. Narrated by Lionel Long. In Italian language.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Shaw, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: The Fountains of Bernini
results.creator_credit: Paul Buckhurst, Robert Hillmann and Centre for Mass Communication, Columbia University
results.brief_description: Takes a look at some of the most important fountains in the history of western art and the life of the genius who created them. The atmosphere of the Baroque Age and Bernini’s own religious, political and aesthetic ideas are conveyed visually as well as through music and narration. Narrated by Steven Gilburn.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Buckhurst, Robert Hillmann and Centre for Mass Communication, Columbia University

The atmosphere of the Baroque Age and Bernini’s own religious, political and aesthetic ideas are conveyed visually as well as through music and narration. Narrated by Steven Gilburn.

results.title: Benjamin
results.creator_credit: Graham Massey, Robin Bates and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
This is the story of the first six months of the life of Benjamin Pile, whose entry into the world on November 22, 1974 was filmed by a ‘Horizon’ team, who then recorded his growth and development in the weeks that followed.

results.title: Kangaroos. Part 1. Biography [Greek version]
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Wildlife”.
Part one begins with the evolution of the kangaroo, tracing its development into over 50 species, from tree-dwellers to the better-known “big red”. The feeding, and mating habits of various species are examined, also birth and development in the pouch are studied. Narrated by Lionel Long. In Greek language.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Shaw, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
